channel.title: [PI] Logging players
channel.description: [size=10pt]How do you log players? Like if they login theres a folder called "logs" and in it a text file named after their account name and on each like it says WHEN he logged in and from WHAT IP\HOST not only ip! And another one to log players trades.. I can do this but im to lazy right now but the IP logging thing Im not trained to do[/size]

item.title: [PI] Logging players
item.dc:creator: @uberpk3r uberpk3r
item.description:
@uberpk3r wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:4, topic:386554”][quote author=uberpk3r link=topic=482312.msg3532283#msg3532283 date=1300269825]
Find where players login AKA welcome msg. Add what you want to have logged there.
[/quote]He wants to log client connections not successful logins.[/quote]

Read again, he want to know the host and the IP, he doesn’t anything about that.

Read full topic

@Wintercanon wrote:

Find where your server uses a BufferedWriter to write the IP to a text document and add the connecting user’s host as well…

Like if they login theres a folder called “logs” and in it a text file named after their account name and on each like it says WHEN he logged in and from WHAT IP\HOST not only ip!
And another one to log players trades… I can do this but im to lazy right now but the IP logging thing Im not trained to do[/size]
